question: I am a 59 year old, caucasion, woman who has enjoyed reasonably good health over the years.  I am 5'1" and weigh 135lbs.  I have never drank alcohol nor smoked any tobacco products.  I exercise by walking 2 1/2 - 3 miles 4 times a week and eat a fairly well varied diet which includes vegetables and fruit.However, two years ago I was diagnosed with a hypo-thyroid -- this is being controlled with Levoxyl, 0.125mg once a day.  A short time later, I learned that I have Type II diabetes and am currently taking 2 Glipizide, 5mg, tablets twice a day.  I also learned, at the same time, that I had high cholesterol which is controlled with Lipitor, 20mg once a day.  Other medications that I take daily are Vioxx, 25mg once a day; and Prem/Pro 0.625/2.5mg once a day.Right about the same time that I learned about the diabetes, I learned that my liver enzymes were high.  After several blood tests and a sonogram, I was told that I have a fatty liver, or otherwise referred to as Steato Hepatitus.  The doctor that gave me that diagnosis has left my area.  A new doctor who had not read my records, and hasn't reviewed my test results for this condition, told me that I have NASH.  Are these two diagnosis the same?  If not what is the difference.I have been having difficulty bringing my blood sugar down, it's in the 135-145 range after sleeping and fasting for 8 to 10 hours.  My General Medicine Physician has suggested that I take Glucophage in addition to the Glipizide for better control.  I have read in several sources that Glucophage can have a negative affect on the liver.  Is this true?  I have opted not to take Glucophage at this time.Does a fatty liver decrease life expectancy?  Is this condition reversable?  If so, what do I need to do to reverse it?  Are any of the medications that I am currently taking detrimental to the fatty liver condition?  I am told that a fatty liver can turn into cirrhosis of the liver... how long does it take to go from one end of the spectrum to the other?As you can probably tell, I have a lot of anxiety about my health due to the fatty liver.  I am especially fearful about introducing new medications.I realize that much of my fear is due to a lack of education on this topic, but I cannot seam to get the answeres from my own physicians.  Any help that you can afford me is truly appreciated.
title: Misc. questions ref. consequences of a Fatty Liver/Diabetes
